summary: listen any ending where Jon or Dany dies will be tragic, even if they go out as heroes, you can’t convince me otherwise. because...
body:
listen any ending where Jon or Dany dies will be tragic, even if they go out as heroes, you can’t convince me otherwise. because either of them dying will mean that they’re so close to both getting the things they wanted more than anything–a family and a home, children of their own and somebody to love them unconditionally–only to have it ripped away from them when it’s just within their grasp.

i know the entire story doesn’t hinge on just their characters’ happiness and endgames, but that ain’t bittersweet, even if they were both only still supporting characters. for the leads? it’s a damn travesty.

blog.name: duron1ar
blog.title: Random Thoughts
blog.description: A place for me to put all the different fanfics that I've read and enjoyed. This will pretty much have fanfics from any fandoms that I happen to be in at the moment in addition to other random things that catch my attention.

title: That for Destruction Ice
description:
The Lady of Winterfell is unmarried but not a maid. She stalks around the keep and the grounds with the same grey eyes as Lord Rickard before her.

She sits in the great hall and hears petitions with the same steely look on her face that Lord Brandon had done when his father was away.

She trains in the yard now. To be a woman of war. The turn of her lip just as Lord Eddard’s had once been, determined and dutiful.

And in all these things, a boy trails after her, learning, watching with the same grey eyes.

blog.description: Nina. ASOIAF + David Bowie + random stories of history. I write stuff.

summary: Let’s say Robert dies from his Trident wounds and Lyanna lives in his place.  Would she have a shot at becoming Queen Regent in...
question: Let’s say Robert dies from his Trident wounds and Lyanna lives in his place.  Would she have a shot at becoming Queen Regent in Jon’s name?
answer:
Absolutely not; I disagree very strongly with any idea that any descendant of Aerys II could have been acclaimed in the aftermath of Robert’s Rebellion, given how blatantly Aerys had committed tyranny (and how strongly Rhaegar appeared to condone that tyranny), and this goes doubly so for Jon. In order to have a scenario in which Jon was acclaimed king, the rebel coalition would have had to 1) accept that Rhaegar and Lyanna had been legitimately married (which is still not a certainty, and would definitely not be accepted by the southron ambitions alliance which had arranged and supported a Lyanna-Robert betrothal - as well as, more broadly, any noble family not eager to have its affianced daughters seized at a prince’s pleasure) AND 2) accept that Rhaegar had any right to the throne which he could then pass to Jon (which, again, sort of undermines the entire reason the rebel coalition was fighting, particularly at that point). It would be simply ludicrous to believe that the rebel coalition would choose to acclaim Jon over the still-very-much-alive Stannis.

Of course, the bigger question is whether Lyanna would have even wanted to see Jon made king and herself made his regent. For her sake, I certainly hope that by the time Jon was born, Lyanna had fallen out of love with Rhaegar and realized how incredibly horrible he had been in forcing this relationship. Would she really have wanted to pursue anything in memory of Rhaegar, especially something as chancy and dangerous as declaring him king, when her dying wish IOTL was to be buried at Winterfell and to have Ned keep her son safe? Kept away from home for the better part of two years, Lyanna would probably have most wanted to go back home with her brother and her baby.

Kept away from home for the better part of two years, Lyanna would probably have most wanted to go back home with her brother and her baby.

title: Breaking the Wheel
body:
That would be enough

Daenerys stared at the Fortress feeling terrible. For doing something that she thought correct she had the consequence of stop helping in the War, what more she wanted to do. Besides, she didn’t know how she would look at the rest of her family. It was then that she remembered Jon and how right now he was in danger on a battlefield. Catelyn was the first to find her.

“My dear,” Lady Stark hugged her, “I didn’t expect you to come so soon. Something happened? Is Ned okay?”

“It’s a long story, ma'am,” said Daenerys with an atypical restrained and sad manner.

“I understand, but anyway, I’m glad you’re here,” Catelyn said urgently.

“Have you heard of Jon?” Daenerys assumed what it was about.

“He’s here,” Catelyn clarified, “he’s been hurt for weeks, but don’t worry, he’s better.”

“Excuse me, Mrs. Stark” Daenerys sobbed, and hurried off in search of her beloved.

She went straight to their room. When she opened the door, she was startled by her husband’s downcast state. Daenerys ran to him, lying on his chest full of bandages, her sobs echoing in the room.

‘Dany" Jon struggled to sit “Look around! How lucky we are to be alive.”

“What happened to you?” She asked, crying.

“Calm down, my love, I’m way better than I look,” Jon said as he stroked his wife’s light hair.

“You didn’t answer my question.” Daenerys stood to look at him.

In doing so she noticed that there were scars around Jon’s eyes.

“I was stabbed during a southern attack,” he explained. “They knocked me out, but my men rescued me in time. I was a little blind for four days, they brought me home so I could recover. The good part was that Lady Stark and the girls took care of me and I could wait for you to return.

"You mean you knew I was coming home?” She was shocked. “Have you known for a long time?”

“A week,” he replied. “Father sent me a crow. I endorsed the idea.”

“No, Jon, how-” Daenerys was extremely emotional.

“Robert is my father’s childhood friend,” he said. “He knows how to deal better with the Commander than you do. Plus I know you would fight until the end of the war.”

“But the war is not over yet,” she replied with determination, even worried.

“Ah Dany look around” Jon smiled with all the patience of the world, holding his wife’s hands “look where you are, look where you started. It’s a miracle you’re alive, stay alive and that would be enough.”

Daenerys only answered with a sigh.

“My love,” he held her face, “I don’t pretend to know the challenges you face, the world, the plans you make and remake in your head. But I’m not afraid, I know the person I married. If I meet you at home at the end of the day, that’ll be enough.”

Daenerys hugged him, placating her longing and listening with admiration to every word of her husband. She continued to listen without letting go.

“I don’t want a legacy or money,” Jon continued, “just let me take care of you, get inside your heart, be part of the story you’re going to tell one day. This moment is the first chapter. Just stay with me, Dany. It’ll be enough.”

Daenerys undid her hugs to kiss him. Sometimes she thought she didn’t deserve all his love. She should have been telling him all that after he had escaped death.

She decided to follow Jon’s advice, stay quiet and take care of him until he recovered, enjoying the time and the luck of being together and alive.

“What happened to you?” She asked, crying.

“Calm down, my love, I’m way better than I look,” Jon said as he stroked his wife’s light hair.

“You didn’t answer my question.” Daenerys stood to look at him.

In doing so she noticed that there were scars around Jon’s eyes.

“I was stabbed during a southern attack,” he explained. “They knocked me out, but my men rescued me in time. I was a little blind for four days, they brought me home so I could recover. The good part was that Lady Stark and the girls took care of me and I could wait for you to return.

"You mean you knew I was coming home?” She was shocked. “Have you known for a long time?”

“A week,” he replied. “Father sent me a crow. I endorsed the idea.”

“No, Jon, how-” Daenerys was extremely emotional.

“Robert is my father’s childhood friend,” he said. “He knows how to deal better with the Commander than you do. Plus I know you would fight until the end of the war.”

“But the war is not over yet,” she replied with determination, even worried.

“Ah Dany look around” Jon smiled with all the patience of the world, holding his wife’s hands “look where you are, look where you started. It’s a miracle you’re alive, stay alive and that would be enough.”

Daenerys only answered with a sigh.

“My love,” he held her face, “I don’t pretend to know the challenges you face, the world, the plans you make and remake in your head. But I’m not afraid, I know the person I married. If I meet you at home at the end of the day, that’ll be enough.”

Daenerys hugged him, placating her longing and listening with admiration to every word of her husband. She continued to listen without letting go.

“I don’t want a legacy or money,” Jon continued, “just let me take care of you, get inside your heart, be part of the story you’re going to tell one day. This moment is the first chapter. Just stay with me, Dany. It’ll be enough.”

Daenerys undid her hugs to kiss him. Sometimes she thought she didn’t deserve all his love. She should have been telling him all that after he had escaped death.

She decided to follow Jon’s advice, stay quiet and take care of him until he recovered, enjoying the time and the luck of being together and alive.

blog.name: trashfandomandstuff
blog.title: Things That Are Trashy
blog.description: I collect things that are: funny; make you more aware of the necessary social fight for the improvement of the world; fandom stuff about things I like (books, movies, tv shows etc.../!\ Please consider that I never ever tag my spoilers, ever); things about me, whatever the fuck said "me" might be of do; perhaps more *commercial yet useless sexy expression directed at you, dear tumblr user*

summary: I mean how weird is it that Jon stupidly held everybody down long enough for the Night King to kill down Viserion.
title: I mean how weird is it that Jon stupidly held everybody down long enough for the Night King to kill down Viserion.

1) Either this is poor writing and this episode doesn’t make a lick of sense.

summary: "The look of love  Is in your eyes The look your smile can't disguise The look of love  Is saying so much more than just words...
caption:
“The look of love
Is in your eyes
The look your smile can’t disguise
The look of love
Is saying so much more than just words could ever say
And what my heart has heard,
Well it takes my breath away”

title: game of thrones opinions #1
body: so 20 minutes into the second episode and everything has already hit the fuckin fan. daenerys’s shit brother basically said i would whore you out to get our home back, then she was raped by some king dude, the lil boy was pushed off a fuckin tower for seeing the queen AND HER BROTHER fucking, jon snow has left, the dwarf is the funniest character, the prince is an asshole, how have i gotten here.
